item.title: Disabled Veterans Sports and Special Events Promotion Act of 2005

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Opportunity.

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S12954-12955)

summary.text: Disabled Veterans Sports and Special Events Promotion Act of 2005 - Establishes in the Department of Veterans Affairs an Office of National Veterans Sports Programs and Special Events, headed by a Director, to promote, establish, and carry out programs for the participation of disabled veterans in approved sporting and other events.

bill.title: Disabled Veterans Sports and Special Events Promotion Act of 2005

item.title: Disabled Veterans Sports and Special Events Promotion Act of 2005
A bill to amend title 38, United States Code, to establish in the Department of Veterans Affairs an Office of National Veterans Sports Programs and Special Events.
Disabled Veterans Sports and Special Events Promotion Act of 2005

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
